Thank you for feedback ... nevertheless the problem is not disappeared, is now "hidden". Let me explain:
- at current figures mainnet should weight around 1.5 and 1.6 TB
- your chaindata instead reports 2.0T (which is a lot more)
- restarting rpc daemon is a hint : was it running before and somehow got stuck ?
- is very likely your rpcdaemon has left an "open db transaction" for long time which caused erigon to allocate more and more data pages and actually, after the release, is reusing freed pages

Can you please 
- build db-tools by `make db-tools`
- run `./build/bin/mdbx_stat -ef <path-to-your-chaindata-folder>`
- report output

Ok ... you have an option here which might be long but for sure is shorter than resync from scratch. **Note it requires you have available free storage for extra 1.6 TB somewhere (does not necessarily need to be on the same partition)**.

- stop erigon and rpcdaemon
- run `./build/bin/mdbx_copy -c <path-to-your-chaindata-folder> <path-to-a-partition-where-you-have-1.6TB space>`
- this will create a new compacted db (let's call it B) from original one (let's call it A)
- at completion delete db A (from chaindata folder delete files mdbx.dat and mdbx.lck)
- copy or move same files created in db B into original folder for db A
- restart erigon and rpcdaemon

This procedure might take a lot of time: it depends on your current source and destination hardware (HDD, USB drive, SSD, NVMe ecc) so please be patient.
